description: Colombia has implemented the following procedures for domestic flights: Passengers must arrive two hours in advance of their flight's scheduled time with electronic check-up when possible; Passengers must carry only personal bags that can be stored under the passenger's chair, all others must be checked; It will be recommended to make use of the CoronApp-Colombia app to keep health information; Certain airports will have restricted admissions for workers only; All people entering the airport will have their temperature taken with a contactless thermometer; All persons must use personal protective equipment; Passengers arriving at the air terminals for flights should immediately go to the boarding rooms; Workers will clean up all areas; Passenger registration will be taken at the pre-boarding stage; All are required to respect the physical distancing of 2 meters in areas such as counters, scanners and in the queues for aircraft boarding; Boarding will be authorized only when the aircraft is ready; The aircraft will not be serviced on board; Passengers not to use onboard entertainment systems such as screens and mobile phones; Aircraft bathrooms should not be used if possible; Passengers must remain seated during the flight; All airport and airline personnel will be trained to identify biological hazard situations; Passengers given directions for disembarkation; Passengers must go directly to exit; Passengers must report symptoms within 14 days. Starts on July 1st.

description:
Colombia is enforcung that Companies and workplaces should organize work at home for as many employees as possible. For employees who are required to attend the workplace, at least 3 entry and exit shifts should be organised throughout the working day.
In addition to work at home and shift work, universities and colleges should organize the virtualization of as many classes and activities as possible. To postpone any public or private event of massive concentration, of more than 1,000 people, in close contact, that is to say less than 2 meters. All stations and buses in the system will be not only washed but also disinfected daily. Randomly during the day, stations and buses will be disinfected at off-peak hours. All schools and public establishments must wash and disinfect their common areas daily.
 Priority will be given to initial home care of patients infected with COVID19 . This will be done in order to avoid congestion in the health and emergency services and reduce the risk of contagion. The Ministry of Health and the four health sub-networks in Bogot will organize home delivery of medicines, so that patients with chronic diseases will not have to go to hospitals to pick them up. Public and private health service providers will make joint purchases of mouthwash, gel, alcohol and other supplies to avoid stock-outs and organize adequate distribution.
target_geog_level: All countries
